revised_title: On the Transpiration of Gases and the Influence of Pressure and Temperature
tldr: Thomas Graham investigates the transpiration of various gases and the influence of pressure and temperature on their transpiration velocity. He discovers that the transpiration velocity of gases is related to their densities and that the transpiration time of gases is inversely proportional to their density. Graham also finds that transpiration is generally promoted by density and that the resistance of a capillary tube to the passage of a gas is directly proportional to the length of the tube.
